member.name: T:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint
member.summary: Select Hints to be used with Find and LoadEntity operations

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.HoldLock
member.summary: Hold a shared lock until completion of the transaction instead of releasing the lock as soon as the required table, row, or data page is no longer required. HOLDLOCK is equivalent to SERIALIZABLE.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.NoLock
member.summary: Do not issue shared locks and do not honor exclusive locks. When this option is in effect, it is possible to read an uncommitted transaction or a set of pages that are rolled back in the middle of a read. Dirty reads are possible. Only applies to the SELECT statement.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.PagLock
member.summary: Use page locks where a single table lock would usually be taken.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Perform a scan with the same locking semantics as a transaction running at the READ COMMITTED isolation level. By default, SQL Server 2000 operates at this isolation level.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.ReadPast
member.summary: Skip locked rows. This option causes a transaction to skip rows locked by other transactions that would ordinarily appear in the result set, rather than block the transaction waiting for the other transactions to release their locks on these rows. The READPAST lock hint applies only to transactions operating at READ COMMITTED isolation and will read only past row-level locks. Applies only to the SELECT statement.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Perform a scan with the same locking semantics as a transaction running at the REPEATABLE READ isolation level.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.RowLock
member.summary: Use row-level locks instead of the coarser-grained page- and table-level locks.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.Serializable
member.summary: Perform a scan with the same locking semantics as a transaction running at the SERIALIZABLE isolation level. Equivalent to HOLDLOCK.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.TabLock
member.summary: Use a table lock instead of the finer-grained row- or page-level locks. SQL Server holds this lock until the end of the statement. However, if you also specify HOLDLOCK, the lock is held until the end of the transaction.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.TabLockX
member.summary: Use an exclusive lock on a table. This lock prevents others from reading or updating the table and is held until the end of the statement or transaction.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.UpdLock
member.summary: Use update locks instead of shared locks while reading a table, and hold locks until the end of the statement or transaction. UPDLOCK has the advantage of allowing you to read data (without blocking other readers) and update it later with the assurance that the data has not changed since you last read it.

member.name: F:TRR.O2I.DataAccess.Core.Helpers.SelectHint.XLock
member.summary: Use an exclusive lock that will be held until the end of the transaction on all data processed by the statement. This lock can be specified with either PAGLOCK or TABLOCK, in which case the exclusive lock applies to the appropriate level of granularity.

The name of the stored procedure which will be used to delete this entity. The DataAccess engine will not call in the delete process for any of the childrens delete stored procedures, so children will have to be deleted by the stored procedure defined in this parameter, or manually from client sideIf this parameter is not specified the entity can not be deleted (this may change in the future by generating ad-hoc delete statements)
